summary: zoonotic infections with Vaccinia virus (VACV) were first reported in 1999. the virus is an emerging zoonotic Orthopoxvirus, which infects dairy cattle and farmers in close contact with infected cows. prospective studies could provide critical data that would inform public health planning and response to outbreaks. electronic supplementary material The online version of this article (doi:10.1186/s12942-017-0100-1) contains supplementary material. list of Brazilian outbreaks used to generate ENM, with references. available values are plotted to demonstrate the key environmental parameters and the ecological niche occupied by VACV according to MaxENT predictions (black), 87 Brazilian outbreaks (red) and background (grey) of the remaining 15 bioclim layers not shown in Fig. 4.
